value.title: Protect your identities with Azure AD Identity Protection
value.excerpt: Use the advanced detection and remediation of identity-based threats to protect your Azure Active Directory identities and applications from compromise.

value.title: Protect your Azure Virtual Desktop deployment by using Azure Firewall
value.excerpt: Learn how to deploy and configure Azure Firewall to protect outbound network traffic for Azure Virtual Desktop.

value.title: Combine multiple tables with JOINs in T-SQL
value.excerpt: Combine multiple tables with JOINs in T-SQL

value.title: Resolve security threats with Azure Security Center
value.excerpt: In this module, you’ll use the alert capabilities of Azure Security Center to watch for and respond to threats.

value.title: Secure Azure Active Directory users with Multi-Factor Authentication
value.excerpt: Learn how to use multi-factor authentication with Azure AD to harden your user accounts.

value.title: Secure your application by using OpenID Connect and Azure AD
value.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to enable users to authenticate in multiple systems by using their Azure AD identities.

value.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure’s role-based access control to effectively manage your team’s access to Azure resources.

value.title: Secure your Azure virtual machine disks
value.excerpt: Explore the options for Azure disk encryption to encrypt OS and data disks on existing and new virtual machines.

value.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform
value.excerpt: Explore the broad array of Azure technologies that analyze text or images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data.

value.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production
value.excerpt: Learn about the Site Reliability Engineering approach to the challenge of assuring reliability and gain a better understanding of why it matters.

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Manage services with the Azure portal
value.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Azure cloud platform through the Azure portal, where you create and manage all of your Azure resources.

value.title: Upload, download, and manage data with Azure Storage Explorer
value.excerpt: Azure Storage Explorer allows you to quickly view all the storage services under your account. You can browse through, read, and edit data stored in those services through a user-friendly graphical interface.

value.title: Azure Event Hubs for Apache Kafka | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Shubha Vijayasarathy joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Event Hubs, which makes data ingestion simple, secure, and scalable. As a distributed streaming platform, Event Hubs enables you to stream your data from any source—storing and processing millions of events per second— so you can build dynamic
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/m3UEDhVYc-Q" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Event-based data integration with Azure Data Factory | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Gaurav Malhotra joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Event-driven architecture (EDA), which is a common data integration pattern that involves production, detection, consumption, and reaction to events. Learn how you can do event-based data integration using Azure Data Factory. [01:53] Demo Start   For more

value.title: How to build Azure Workbooks using logs and parameters | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: Discover how to use Azure Workbooks as a visualization tool for #AzureMonitor. Build an interactive, repeatable narrative to monitor your #Azure environment from apps to infrastructure beyond the insights. value.title: How to build tabs and alerts in Azure workbooks | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In workbooks, you can build complex reports but may need a way to segment information in different sections. value.title: How to connect virtual networks across Azure regions with Azure Global VNet peering | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Anavi Nahar joins Donovan Brown to show how virtual network peering enables you to connect networks seamlessly in Azure Virtual Network. The virtual networks appear as one for connectivity purposes. The traffic between virtual machines uses the Microsoft backbone infrastructure. Like traffic between

value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal "How To" series, learn about a new offering in the App Service family, Static Web Apps. value.title: How to edit and debug code in real time with Visual Studio Code Live Share | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you’ll learn how to instantly and securely share your current project, debugging session, terminal instance, localhost web app, and voice and text chat with Live Share extension for Visual Studio Code.     For more tips and tricks, visit: https://aka.ms/azuretipsandtricks

value.title: How to generate SSH public key to log into Linux VM | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to generate SSH public keys to log into a Linux VM with Cloud Shell and BASH on Windows 10. Watch how you can automatically log into a VM without having to put in a password if you SSH into the server.  For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips/

value.title: How to get better outbound connectivity using Azure NAT Gateway | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: When your private virtual networks in Azure need to talk to the Internet, a network translation is needed for your applications to talk to endpoints on the Internet. Christian Kuhtz joins Scott Hanselman to show how it works and why Azure NAT Gateway is the best and most scalable way to do Source Network

value.title: How to publish your APIs with the new developer portal in Azure API Management | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: The all-new API Management developer portal lets you effortlessly publish your APIs. It's customizable, lightweight, and intuitive.
